title: Italian Grand Prix qualifying: Charles Leclerc takes pole position in farcical circumstances at Monza
text:
Ferrari's Charles Leclerc will start Sunday's Italian Grand Prix on pole position after finishing fastest in qualifying in farcical circumstances at Monza.

Formula One's rising star delivered another impressive performance to see off Lewis Hamilton by just 0.039 seconds and claim his second pole in as many weeks, the third of his career.

Leclerc topped the timesheets after his fellow frontrunners failed to get a second flying lap in as they waited for a slipstream.

Sebastian Vettel in the sister Ferrari could manage only fourth as he played second fiddle to Leclerc once more following the young Monegasque's maiden win in Belgium last weekend.

Valtteri Bottas lines up in third.

"It feels amazing," said Leclerc. "I am happy with the pole."

Hamilton is bidding for a record-breaking sixth victory at the Cathedral of Speed, and the Mercedes star is well placed to take the challenge to Leclerc on Sunday.

"I have to be grateful that I am on the front row," he said. "We get to have a fight on with the Ferraris tomorrow."
